]]> European Visa Requirements and Application 2024 https://regulatedunitedeurope.com/blog/european-visa-requirements-and-application-2024/ Sat, 27 Jul 2024 15:21:18 +0000 https://regulatedunitedeurope.com/?p=18968 The post European Visa Requirements and Application 2024 appeared first on RegulatedUnitedEurope.

]]>

In 2024, visa requirements for third-country nationals to enter Europe continue to depend on many factors, including the purpose of the trip, the length of stay and whether the destination country is a member of the Schengen area. It should be noted that information is subject to change and it is advisable to check the data on the official websites of embassies and consulates before planning a trip.

General Visa Requirements

In general, third-country nationals need to provide the following documents and information to obtain a visa to European countries:

  • A passport valid for at least 3 months after the expected date of departure from the Schengen area, with two free pages.
  • Visa application form, completed and signed.
  • A photograph that meets the requirements for visa photos.
  • Insurance covering at least 30,000 euros worth of medical expenses in Europe.
  • Confirmation of accommodation booking or invitation from the host country.
  • Evidence of financial solvency, ability to cover living expenses during the stay.
  • Round trip tickets or booking confirmation.
  • Visa fees, which may vary depending on the type of visa and country.

Specifics depending on the purpose of the trip

  • Tourist visa: for short trips for tourism purposes.
  • Business visa: for business travel, including participation in conferences, seminars, meetings.
  • Student visa: for study, requires additional documents to prove enrolment in an educational institution.
  • Work visa: to work, you must have a job offer or contract from a European employer.

Peculiarities of the visa regime in the Schengen area

A Schengen visa is required to enter Schengen countries, which allows you to travel within the zone without passport controls at internal borders. The Schengen visa can be a short-term visa (type C) for stays of up to 90 days in any 180-day period, or a national long-term visa (type D) for stays of more than 90 days.

 Albania visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, visa requirements for third-country nationals to enter Albania remain focused on securing borders and managing migration flows, while providing opportunities for tourism, business, education and cultural exchange. It is important to note that visa policies are subject to change, so it is advisable to check the most up-to-date information on official Albanian government resources or diplomatic missions before planning a trip.

Basic requirements for obtaining a visa to Albania:

  1. Foreign passport

The passport must be valid for at least 6 months from the expected date of entry into Albania.

  1. Visa application form

A completed and signed visa application form. The application form can usually be downloaded from the official website of the Albanian embassy or consulate.

  1. Photos

Standard passport size colour photographs that meet the visa photo requirements.

  1. Confirmation of the purpose of the trip

It can be a tourist invitation, a hotel reservation, an invitation from an organisation or a private person in Albania, tickets for events, etc.

  1. Proof of financial solvency

Sufficient funds to cover living expenses during your stay in Albania. This can be a bank statement, a letter from a sponsor, etc.

  1. Health insurance

An insurance policy covering medical expenses for the period of stay in Albania.

  1. Visa fee

The visa fee depends on the type of visa and may vary. It is necessary to check the current fee at the time of application.

Additional documents

Depending on the purpose of the trip, additional documents may be required, such as an invitation from an Albanian company for business visits, documents confirming the purpose of the study trip, etc.

Features

  • Citizens of some countries can enter Albania without a visa for a short period of time. The list of visa-free countries is regularly updated and should be checked before travelling.

Latvia visa requirements and application 2024

Latvia continues to attract tourists, businessmen and students from all over the world in 2024. As a member state of the European Union and the Schengen area, Latvia follows the general Schengen requirements for issuing visas to third-country nationals. However, there are specific aspects related to obtaining a visa specifically for Latvia. Below is a detailed overview of the requirements for obtaining a visa to enter Latvia in 2024.

Basic Visa Requirements

  1. Foreign passport

Must be valid for at least 3 months after the end of the scheduled visit and have at least 2 blank pages.

  1. Visa application

Completed and signed Schengen visa application form. The application form is available on the website of the Latvian embassy or consulate.

  1. Photography

One recent passport size colour photograph that meets visa photo standards.

  1. Insurance

Health insurance covering the entire period of stay in the Schengen area with a minimum cover of 30,000 euros.

  1. Financial guarantees

Proof of sufficient funds to cover living expenses in Latvia. This can be a bank statement, income documents, letter of guarantee from the inviting party, etc.

  1. Reservation of accommodation

Confirmation of hotel or other accommodation in Latvia, or an invitation from a private person.

  1. Visa fee

Payment of the visa fee, the amount of which depends on the type of visa and the category of the applicant.

Additional Requirements

  • Round trip tickets or other proof of planned departure date from the Schengen area.
  • A business visa requires an invitation from a Latvian company as well as proof of business ties.
  • For study visa it is necessary to submit documents confirming enrolment in an educational institution in Latvia.
  • Documents for children travelling with parents or guardians, including birth certificate and, if necessary, travel consent from the other parent.

 Andorra visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Andorra continues to attract tourists with its mountainous landscapes, winter sports and tax-free shopping. Although Andorra does not have its own airport and is not a member of the European Union or Schengen Agreement, most foreign nationals need to pass through France or Spain to enter the country, which makes the visa application process a bit tricky.

Visa Requirements for Entry into Andorra

As Andorra does not issue its own visas, third country nationals need to obtain a double or multiple entry Schengen visa issued by France or Spain to visit Andorra. This will allow you to cross the border and enter Andorra through one of these countries. Here are the basic steps and requirements to consider:

1 Determining the Type of Visa

Depending on the purpose of your trip (tourism, business, study, etc.) you will need to determine which type of Schengen visa is most suitable for your trip.

  1. Submission of the Application

The application for a Schengen visa is submitted to the consulate or embassy of France or Spain, depending on which country you plan to enter Andorra through. You will need to fill in an application form and collect the necessary documents.

  1. Required Documents
  • A valid passport.
  • Completed and signed visa application form.
  • Photographs that meet the requirements for the visa.
  • Proof of accommodation booking in Andorra or in the country of entry (France/Spain).
  • Insurance covering the entire period of stay in the Schengen area.
  • Evidence of sufficient funds to cover expenses while travelling.
  • Round trip tickets or travel plans.
  1. Visa Fee

Payment of the visa fee, the amount of which depends on the type of visa and the age of the applicant.

  1. Timeframes for Processing

Processing times for visa applications can vary, so it is advisable to apply early.

Additional Tips

  • Checking Current Restrictions: Given the changing COVID-19 situation, it is important to check in advance the current entry restrictions and health requirements for entry into France, Spain and Andorra.
  • Road Map: As Andorra is only accessible by road, make sure you have all the necessary documents to cross the border, including a hire car if applicable.

Visiting Andorra requires careful planning, especially when it comes to visa and border formalities. Despite not having its own visa system, compliance with Schengen visa requirements and prior preparation will ensure a smooth entry and a pleasant stay in this principality.

 Liechtenstein visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024 Liechtenstein, like many countries in Europe, continues to attract international visitors due to its unique culture, history and natural beauty. Although Liechtenstein is one of the smallest countries in the world, visa requirements for third-country nationals are subject to the general rules of the Schengen Agreement because the country is a member. This means that you may need a Schengen visa to visit Liechtenstein. Here is a detailed overview of the requirements for obtaining such a visa in 2024.

Types of Schengen Visas

Third-country nationals generally require one of the following types of visas to visit Liechtenstein:

  • Short-stay visa (type C): For stays of up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
  • National visa (type D): For longer stays, e.g. for study or work.

Basic Requirements for Obtaining a Visa

  1. Foreign passport

Must be valid for a minimum of 3 months after the end of the scheduled visit and contain at least two blank pages.

  1. Completed visa application form

The application form must be neatly filled out in one of the official languages of the country or in English, signed and dated by the applicant.

  1. Photos

Two recent passport-size photographs that meet Schengen visa standards.

  1. Insurance

Travellers must have health insurance covering the entire period of stay in the Schengen area with a minimum cover of €30,000.

  1. Financial guarantees

Proof of sufficient funds to cover living expenses in Liechtenstein during the visit.

  1. Reservation of accommodation

Confirmation of a hotel or other accommodation booking, or an invitation from a private individual if you are staying with someone.

  1. Visa fee

A visa fee must be paid, the amount of which may vary depending on the type of visa and the age of the applicant.

Additional Documents

Depending on the purpose of the visit, additional documents may be required, such as:

  • Invitation from the organisation to participate in activities.
  • Documents from the institution for students.
  • Contract of employment for those in employment.

Important Notes

  • Information Check: Visa requirements are subject to change, so before applying it is important to check the latest information on the official website of the embassy or consulate of the country through which you plan to enter Liechtenstein.
  • COVID-19: Additional restrictions or requirements may apply due to the pandemic, such as a negative test, certificate of vaccination, or certificate of past illness.

Obtaining a visa to visit Liechtenstein requires careful preparation and attention to detail. Make sure you follow all instructions and gather all necessary documents to ensure a successful outcome of your visa application.

 Lithuania visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Lithuania continues to attract foreign visitors with its rich history, cultural heritage and natural beauty. As a member state of the European Union and the Schengen area, Lithuania follows common rules for issuing visas to third-country nationals wishing to visit the country. Below is a detailed overview of the requirements and procedures for obtaining a visa to Lithuania in 2024.

Types of Visas

  • Short-stay visa (type C): intended for tourist trips, short business visits, participation in cultural or sporting events and short training courses. Valid for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
  • National visa (type D): for those who plan to stay in Lithuania for a longer period of time, e.g. for study, work or family reunification.

General Visa Requirements

  • Foreign passport
  • Must be valid for at least 3 months after the expected end date of travel and have a minimum of two blank pages.
  • Completed visa application form
  • The application form shall be filled in Lithuanian, English or Russian and signed by the applicant.
  • Photos
  • Two recent passport-size photographs that meet the requirements of Schengen visas.
  • Insurance
  • Health insurance for the entire period of stay with coverage of at least 30,000 euros.
  • Financial evidence
  • Documents proving that you have sufficient funds to live in Lithuania during the visit.
  • Confirmation of the purpose of the trip
  • May include a hotel reservation, invitation from an individual or company, event tickets, round trip tickets, etc.
  • Visa fee
  • Visa application processing fee.

Additional Requirements

Depending on the type of visa and purpose of travel, additional documents may be required, such as:

  • For business visa: invitation from a Lithuanian company, confirmation of business programme.
  • For student visa: documents on admission to an educational institution.
  • For work visa: employment contract with a Lithuanian employer.

Important Notes

  • COVID-19: Current requirements and restrictions related to the COVID-19 pandemic that may affect the visa and entry process should be considered.
  • Precise information: Always check the information on the official website of the Lithuanian Embassy or Consulate before applying, as requirements may change.

Obtaining a visa to Lithuania requires careful attention to the collection and preparation of all necessary documents. Pay special attention to details and follow all instructions to ensure a successful visa application and an enjoyable journey to Lithuania.

 Austria visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Austria continues to welcome citizens from third world countries who wish to visit the country for tourism, business, study or other reasons. As a member of the European Union and the Schengen area, Austria follows common visa rules for short and long-term stays. Here is a detailed overview of the visa requirements for third country nationals to enter Austria in 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

A short-stay visa allows you to stay in Austria and other Schengen countries for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.

Basic Requirements:

  • Passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the expected end date of travel and have a minimum of 2 free pages.
  • Visa application form: Completed and signed.
  • Photograph: Two recent passport-size colour photographs.
  • Insurance: Health insurance covering the entire period of stay in the Schengen area with a minimum cover of 30,000 euros.
  • Financial guarantees: Evidence of sufficient funds to cover living expenses.
  • Accommodation: Confirmation of hotel reservation or invitation from a private person.
  • Visa Fee: Fee for processing the visa application.

Additional Documents:

May be required depending on the purpose of the trip, e.g. invitation from an organisation for a business trip, tour booking documents for a tourist trip, invitation from an educational institution for students.

Long-term Visa and Residence Permit (Type D)

A national visa (type D) or residence permit is required to stay in Austria for more than 90 days.

Basic Requirements:

  • Application: For a national visa or residence permit.
  • A valid passport.
  • Photos.
  • Purpose of stay: Documents confirming the purpose of long-term stay (work, study, family reunification).
  • Financial guarantees: Proof of sufficient funds to live in Austria.
  • Health insurance: To cover the first few months of your stay.

Important Notes

  • COVID-19: Check current requirements and restrictions related to the pandemic.
  • Up-to-date information: Always check the official website of the Austrian embassy or consulate for the most current visa application requirements and procedures.
  • Processing Time: Processing times for visa applications can vary, start the application process early.

Obtaining a visa to enter Austria requires careful preparation and attention to detail. Follow all instructions and collect the necessary documents well in advance to ensure a successful visa application and enjoy your trip to one of the most beautiful countries in Europe.

 Luxembourg visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Luxembourg continues to attract international visitors with its unique blend of historical heritage and modern culture, and as an important financial and European political centre. Third-country nationals wishing to visit Luxembourg need to take into account a number of visa requirements that are in line with the general Schengen rules. Here is a detailed overview of these requirements for 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

A short-stay visa entitles you to stay in Luxembourg and other Schengen countries for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.

Basic Requirements:

  • Passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the date of departure from the Schengen area and have at least two free pages.
  • Visa Application Form: A completed and signed Schengen visa application form.
  • Photographs: Two recent passport-size colour photographs that meet the requirements for visa photos.
  • Insurance: A valid health insurance policy with coverage of at least 30,000 euros, covering all Schengen countries.
  • Financial guarantees: Proof of sufficient funds to live in Luxembourg during the stay.
  • Accommodation Booking: Confirmation of hotel booking or proof of other accommodation.
  • Visa Fee: A visa application processing fee must be paid.

Additional Documents:

Depending on the purpose of the trip, additional documents may be required, e.g. invitation letters from individuals or organisations, confirmation of the business purpose of the visit, tour booking documents, etc.

Long-term visa and residence permit

To stay in Luxembourg for more than 90 days, you must apply for a national visa (type D) or a residence permit.

Basic Requirements:

  • Application: Completed application form for a national visa or residence permit.
  • A valid passport.
  • Financial evidence: Ability to support yourself during your stay.
  • Health insurance: To cover medical expenses in Luxembourg.
  • Documents confirming the purpose of stay: e.g. work contract, invitation from an educational institution, etc.

Important Notes

  • Checking up-to-date information: Visa requirements and procedures can change, so it is important to check the latest information on the official website of the Luxembourg Embassy or the website of the Luxembourg Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs.
  • COVID-19: Possible limitations or additional requirements related to the pandemic should be considered.

Obtaining a visa to enter Luxembourg requires careful planning and preparation. Make sure you follow all the recommendations and collect all the necessary documents to ensure a successful visa application and a pleasant stay in this charming country.

 Malta visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Malta continues to attract tourists, businessmen and students from all over the world due to its rich cultural heritage, beautiful beaches and favourable climate. As a member of the European Union and the Schengen area, Malta follows the general requirements of the Schengen Agreement when issuing visas to third country nationals. Here is a detailed overview of the visa requirements for travelling to Malta in 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

The short-stay visa is for stays in Malta and other Schengen countries of up to 90 days within a 180-day period.

Basic Requirements:

  • Passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the expected end date of travel and have at least two blank pages.
  • Visa application form: Completed and signed.
  • Photographs: Two recent passport-size colour photographs that meet the requirements for visa photos.
  • Insurance: Health insurance for the whole period of stay with a cover of at least 30,000 euros.
  • Financial guarantees: Proof of sufficient funds to live in Malta.
  • Accommodation: Confirmation of hotel reservation or invitation from a private person.
  • Visa Fee: The fee for processing a visa application.

Additional Documents:

May be required depending on the purpose of the trip, including event tickets, invitations from organisations, proof of business purpose of the visit, etc.

Long-term visa and residence permit

A national visa (type D) or residence permit is required to stay in Malta for more than 90 days.

Basic Requirements:

  • Application: Completed application form for a national visa or residence permit.
  • A valid passport.
  • Financial evidence: Ability to support yourself during your stay.
  • Health Insurance: To cover medical expenses in Malta.
  • Documents confirming the purpose of stay: e.g. work contract, invitation from an educational institution, etc.

Important Notes

  • Checking up-to-date information: Visa requirements and procedures can change, so it is important to check the latest information on the official website of the Maltese Embassy or the Maltese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

 Belgium visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Belgium continues to attract international visitors wishing to explore its rich cultural heritage, savour its fine cuisine and explore its historical sites. Belgium, as a member state of the European Union and the Schengen area, facilitates the visa application process for third country nationals by following the general rules of the Schengen Agreement. Here is a detailed overview of the visa requirements for travelling to Belgium in 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

A short-stay visa entitles you to stay in Belgium and other Schengen countries for up to 90 days within a 180-day period.

Basic Requirements:

  • Passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the expected date of departure from the Schengen area and have at least two free pages.
  • Visa Application Form: A completed and signed Schengen visa application form.
  • Photographs: Two recent passport-size colour photographs that meet the requirements for visa photos.
  • Insurance: A valid health insurance policy with coverage of at least 30,000 euros, covering all Schengen countries.
  • Financial guarantees: Proof of sufficient funds to live in Belgium during the stay.
  • Accommodation: Confirmation of hotel reservation or invitation from a private person.
  • Visa Fee: The fee for processing a visa application.

Additional Documents:

May be required depending on the purpose of the trip, including event tickets, invitations from organisations, proof of business purpose of the visit, etc.

Long-term visa and residence permit

A national visa (type D) or residence permit is required to stay in Belgium for more than 90 days.

Basic Requirements:

  • Application: Completed application form for a national visa or residence permit.
  • A valid passport.
  • Financial evidence: Ability to support yourself during your stay.
  • Health insurance: To cover medical expenses in Belgium.
  • Documents confirming the purpose of stay: e.g. work contract, invitation from an educational institution, etc.

Important Notes

  • Checking up-to-date information: Visa requirements and procedures can change, so it is important to check the latest information on the official website of the Belgian Embassy or the website of the Belgian Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
  • COVID-19: Possible limitations or additional requirements related to the pandemic should be considered.

Obtaining a visa to enter Belgium requires careful preparation and attention to detail. Make sure you follow all the guidelines and collect all the necessary documents to ensure a successful visa application and an enjoyable stay in this magnificent country.

 Montenegro visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024 Montenegro, known for its picturesque mountain scenery, crystal clear Adriatic Sea and rich cultural heritage, continues to attract tourists from all over the world. For third country nationals interested in visiting Montenegro, it is important to know the current visa requirements. Here is a detailed overview of these requirements for 2024.

Montenegro Visa Regime

Montenegro offers a flexible visa regime, allowing citizens of many countries to visit Montenegro without a visa for up to 90 days within 180 days. However, citizens of some countries may still require a visa to enter Montenegro.

Visa requirements

To apply for a visa to Montenegro, third country nationals need to provide the following documents:

  1. Foreign passport
  • Must be valid for a minimum of 3 months after the expected end date of the visit.
  • Minimum of one blank page for visa.
  1. Completed visa application form
  • The application form must be fully completed and signed by the applicant.
  1. Photography
  • One recent passport-size colour photograph conforming to international standards.
  1. Evidence of financial solvency
  • Bank statements, proof of income or other documents proving sufficient funds to stay in Montenegro.
  1. Confirmation of accommodation booking
  • Hotel reservation or confirmation of apartment/home rental for the period of stay.
  1. Health insurance
  • Valid health insurance for the entire period of stay.
  1. Visa fee
  • Payment of the visa fee, the amount of which may vary.

Additional Documents

Depending on the purpose of the trip, additional documents may be required, such as:

  • Invitation letter from a private person or organisation in Montenegro.
  • Confirmation of the business purpose of the trip for business visits.
  • An invitation from the institution for students.

Important Notes

  • COVID-19: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, entry requirements are subject to change. It is important to check for up-to-date information before planning your trip.
  • Up-to-date information: Before applying for a visa, it is recommended to check the most up-to-date information on the official website of the Embassy of Montenegro or the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro, as visa requirements may change.

Obtaining a visa to Montenegro in 2024 requires careful preparation and attention to collecting the necessary documents. By following the above recommendations and requirements, you will increase your chances of successfully obtaining a visa and will be able to enjoy your trip to this beautiful country.

 Bulgaria visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Bulgaria, a country with a rich historical heritage, picturesque mountains and beautiful beaches of the Black Sea, continues to attract tourists, businessmen and students from all over the world. As a member of the European Union, Bulgaria applies certain visa requirements for third country nationals who wish to visit the country. Here is a detailed overview of these requirements for 2024.

Types of Visas

Bulgaria offers several types of visas depending on the purpose of the visit:

  • Tourist visa (Type C): For short-term trips for the purpose of tourism.
  • Business visa (Type C): For business trips, participation in conferences and seminars.
  • Student visa (Type D): For foreign students enrolled in Bulgarian educational institutions.
  • Work visa (Type D): For foreigners who have received a job offer from a Bulgarian employer.

Basic Requirements for Obtaining a Visa

  1. Foreign passport
  • Must be valid for a minimum of 3 months after the end of the scheduled visit.
  • Minimum of two blank pages for visa and stamps.
  1. Visa application form
  • Completed and signed application form. Available on the official website of the Bulgarian Embassy or Consulate.
  1. Photos
  • Two recent passport size colour photographs.
  1. Insurance
  • Valid health insurance for the entire period of stay with coverage of at least 30,000 euros.
  1. Financial guarantees
  • Evidence of sufficient funds to cover expenses during the stay.
  1. Reservation of accommodation
  • Confirmation of hotel or other accommodation booking. In the case of an invitation from a private person, the relevant documents are required.
  1. Visa fee
  • Payment of the visa fee, the amount of which depends on the type of visa.

Additional Documents

  • For business visa: Invitation from Bulgarian company, confirmation of business meetings.
  • For student visa: Confirmation of enrolment in an educational institution.
  • For work visa: Employment contract or invitation from the employer.

Important Notes

  • Up-to-date information: Before applying for a visa, you should check the current requirements and procedures on the official website of the Bulgarian Embassy or Consulate in your country, as regulations may change.
  • COVID-19: Due to the pandemic, additional requirements for entry and stay in Bulgaria may apply, including presentation of a certificate of vaccination, a negative test for COVID-19 or a certificate of past illness.

Obtaining a visa to Bulgaria requires careful preparation and compliance with all established procedures. Pay attention to collecting the necessary documents and follow the current requirements to ensure successful visa application and enjoy your trip to this beautiful country.

 Netherlands visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, the Netherlands continues to welcome visitors from around the world, offering them the opportunity to explore the country’s rich culture, historic cities and picturesque landscapes. As a member of the European Union and the Schengen area, the Netherlands requires third-country nationals to fulfil certain visa requirements. Below is a detailed overview of these requirements for 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

The short-stay visa is for trips of up to 90 days in any 180-day period and covers tourist, business trips, short training courses and other types of visits.

Basic Requirements:

  • Passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the end of the planned visit and have at least two free pages.
  • Visa application form: Completed and signed.
  • Photo: Two recent passport-size colour photographs conforming to international standards.
  • Insurance: A valid health insurance policy with coverage of at least 30,000 euros, covering all Schengen countries.
  • Financial guarantees: Evidence of sufficient funds to cover expenses during the stay.
  • Accommodation: Confirmation of hotel reservation or invitation from a private person.
  • Visa fee: Payment of the visa fee.

Additional Documents:

Additional documents may be required depending on the purpose of the trip, e.g. invitation from a company for business visits, confirmation of an educational institution for students, etc.

Long-term visa and residence permit

A national visa (type D) or residence permit is required to stay in the Netherlands for more than 90 days, depending on the purpose of the long-term stay.

Basic Requirements:

  • Application: For a national visa or residence permit.
  • A valid passport.
  • Photographs: Eligible.
  • Financial evidence: To prove the ability to support yourself during your stay.
  • Health insurance: To cover medical expenses.
  • Documents confirming the purpose of stay: e.g. employment contract, invitation from an educational institution, etc.

Important Notes

  • Checking up-to-date information: Visa requirements and procedures can change, so it is important to check the latest information on the official website of the Dutch Embassy or Consulate.
  • COVID-19: Consider possible limitations and requirements associated with a pandemic, including vaccination, testing and quarantine requirements.

Obtaining a visa to enter the Netherlands requires careful preparation and attention to gathering the necessary documents. By following these requirements and recommendations, you will increase your chances of successfully obtaining a visa and will be able to enjoy your trip to this beautiful country.

 Croatia visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024 Croatia, known for its breathtaking natural beauty, historical monuments and beautiful Adriatic beaches, continues to attract tourists from all over the world. Croatia is a member of the European Union, but at the time of writing it is not yet part of the Schengen area, which means separate visa requirements for third country nationals. Here’s a detailed overview of the visa requirements for travelling to Croatia in 2024.

Types of Visas

Croatia offers several types of visas, depending on the purpose of the trip:

  • Short-stay visa (Type C): for tourism, business travel or short training courses, involving a stay of up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
  • Long-term visa (Type D): for long-term stay, including study, work or family reunification.

Basic Requirements for Obtaining a Visa

  1. Valid passport
  • Must be valid for at least 3 months after the expected date of departure from Croatia.
  • A minimum of two blank pages for the visa.
  1. Completed visa application form
  • The application form shall be filled in Croatian or English and signed by the applicant.
  1. Photos
  • Two recent passport size colour photographs that meet the requirements.
  1. Insurance
  • Health insurance covering the entire period of stay, with a minimum cover of 30,000 euros.
  1. Financial evidence
  • Proof of sufficient funds to cover expenses during the stay in Croatia.
  1. Reservation of accommodation
  • Confirmation of a hotel or other accommodation booking, or an invitation from a private individual.
  1. Visa fee
  • Payment of the visa fee, the amount of which depends on the type of visa and the category of the applicant.

Additional Documents

Depending on the purpose of the trip, additional documents may be required, such as:

  • Invitation from the company for business visits.
  • Confirmation from an educational institution for student visas.
  • Labour contract for work visas.

Important Notes

  • Up-to-date information: Before applying for a visa, you should check the current requirements and procedures on the official website of the Croatian Embassy or the Croatian Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs, as visa regulations may change.
  • COVID-19: Due to the pandemic, there may be additional entry requirements such as showing a certificate of vaccination, a negative test for COVID-19 or a certificate of past illness.

Obtaining a visa to Croatia requires careful preparation of documents and fulfilment of all requirements. By following these recommendations, you will increase your chances of successfully obtaining a visa and will be able to enjoy your trip to this beautiful country.

 Norway visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Norway continues to attract global attention for its breathtaking scenery, rich history and high quality of life. The country, known for its fjords, northern lights and unique cultural heritage, is a popular destination for tourists, business travellers, students and those seeking immigration opportunities. As a member of the Schengen area, Norway sets certain visa requirements for third-country nationals. Here is a detailed overview of these requirements for 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

The short-stay visa is for tourist trips, business visits, short-term training courses and other trips of up to 90 days in any 180-day period.

Basic Requirements:

  • Passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the expected end date of travel and have at least two blank pages.
  • Visa application form: Completed and signed.
  • Photographs: Two recent colour passport size photographs of international standards.
  • Insurance: A valid health insurance policy with coverage of at least 30,000 euros, covering all Schengen countries.
  • Financial guarantees: Evidence of sufficient funds to cover expenses during the stay.
  • Accommodation: Confirmation of hotel reservation or invitation from a private person.
  • Visa fee: Payment of the visa fee.

Additional Documents:

May be required depending on the purpose of the trip, including an invitation from an organisation for business visits, confirmation of an educational institution for students, etc.

Long-term visa and residence permit

Staying in Norway for more than 90 days requires a national visa (type D) or a residence permit, depending on the purpose of the long-term stay.

Basic Requirements:

  • Application: For a national visa or residence permit.
  • A valid passport.
  • Photographs: Eligible.
  • Financial evidence: To prove the ability to support yourself during your stay.
  • Health insurance: To cover medical expenses.
  • Documents confirming the purpose of stay: e.g. employment contract, invitation from an educational institution, etc.

Important Notes

  • Up-to-date information: Before applying for a visa, you should check the current requirements and procedures on the official website of the Norwegian Embassy or the Norwegian Directorate of Immigration (UDI), as visa regulations may change.
  • COVID-19: Possible limitations and requirements associated with a pandemic, including vaccination, testing and quarantine requirements, should be considered.

 Cyprus visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Cyprus continues to attract tourists, business travellers and students due to its mild climate, rich history and cultural heritage. The island nation, which is a member of the European Union, offers a variety of holiday, study and business opportunities. For third country nationals seeking to visit Cyprus, it is important to know the current visa requirements. Here is a detailed overview of these requirements for 2024.

Types of Visas

Cyprus offers several types of visas, depending on the purpose of the visit:

  • Short-term visa (Type C): Intended for tourist trips, business visits or short training courses up to 90 days.
  • Long-term visa (Type D): For those planning a long term stay in Cyprus, including study, work or family reunification.

Basic Requirements for Obtaining a Visa

  1. Valid passport
  • Must be valid for at least 3 months after the end of the scheduled visit.
  • A minimum of two blank pages for the visa.
  1. Completed visa application form
  • The application form must be fully completed in English or Greek and signed by the applicant.
  1. Photos
  • Two recent passport-size colour photographs of international standards.
  1. Insurance
  • Health insurance covering the entire period of stay in Cyprus, with a minimum cover of €30,000.
  1. Financial guarantees
  • Evidence of sufficient funds to cover expenses while in Cyprus.
  1. Reservation of accommodation
  • Confirmation of a hotel or other accommodation booking, or an invitation from a private individual.
  1. Visa fee
  • Payment of the visa fee, the amount of which depends on the type of visa and the category of the applicant.

Additional Documents

Depending on the purpose of the trip, additional documents may be required, such as:

  • Invitation from the company for business visits.
  • Confirmation from the institution for students.
  • Labour contract for work visas.

Important Notes

  • Up-to-date information: Before applying for a visa you should check the current requirements and procedures on the official website of the Cypriot Embassy or the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Cyprus, as visa regulations may change.
  • COVID-19: Consider possible limitations and requirements associated with a pandemic, including vaccination, testing and quarantine requirements.

Obtaining a visa to enter Cyprus requires careful attention to the preparation of documents and compliance with all established requirements. By following these guidelines, you will increase your chances of successfully obtaining a visa and enjoy your trip to this beautiful island.

 Poland visa requirements and application 2024

In 2024, Poland continues to attract the attention of international visitors due to its rich historical heritage, cultural diversity and picturesque landscapes. The country, as a member of the European Union and Schengen Area, sets certain visa requirements that must be fulfilled by third-country nationals wishing to visit Poland. Here is a detailed overview of the visa requirements for travelling to Poland in 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

The short-stay visa is intended for tourist trips, business visits, participation in cultural and scientific events, short training courses or travel for other purposes that do not require a long-term stay. The duration of stay must not exceed 90 days in any 180-day period.

Basic Requirements:

  • Valid passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the planned date of departure from the Schengen area and have at least two free pages.
  • Completed visa application form: Available on the website of the Polish Embassy or Consulate.
  • Photographs: Two recent passport-size colour photographs that meet Schengen visa requirements.
  • Insurance: Health insurance covering the entire period of stay in the Schengen area, with a minimum cover of 30,000 euros.
  • Financial guarantees: Evidence of sufficient funds to cover expenses during the stay.
  • Accommodation booking: Confirmation of hotel reservation or invitation from a private person/organisation.
  • Visa Fee: The visa fee must be paid in the amount established by law.

Additional Documents:

Depending on the purpose of the trip, additional documents may be required, such as letters of invitation from organisations or individuals, proof of business meetings, conference registration, proof of study plans, etc.

Long-term Visa and Residence Permit (Type D)

Staying in Poland for more than 90 days requires a national visa (type D) or a residence permit, depending on the purpose and duration of stay.

Basic Requirements:

  • Visa/residence permit application: Completed as required.
  • A valid passport.
  • Proof of purpose of stay: Employment contract, invitation from an educational institution, documents confirming family ties, etc.
  • Financial guarantees: To prove the ability to support yourself during your stay.
  • Health insurance: To cover medical expenses in Poland.

Important Notes

  • Up-to-date information: Before applying for a visa, it is recommended to check the current requirements on the official website of the Polish Embassy or Consulate in your country, as visa regulations may change.
  • COVID-19: Possible limitations and additional requirements associated with a pandemic should be considered.

In 2024, the Czech Republic continues to attract global attention with its historic cities, magnificent castles and rich cultural life. Located in the centre of Europe, the Czech Republic is a member of the European Union and the Schengen area, which determines visa requirements for third country nationals. Here is a detailed overview of these requirements for 2024.

Short Stay Visa (Schengen Visa, Type C)

A short-stay visa is for tourist trips, business visits, short training courses or other types of travel of up to 90 days in any 180-day period.

Basic Requirements:

  • Valid passport: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the expected end date of travel and have a minimum of two blank pages.
  • Completed visa application form: The application form must be filled in Czech or English and signed by the applicant.
  • Photographs: Two recent passport-size colour photographs that meet Schengen visa requirements.
  • Insurance: A valid health insurance policy with coverage of at least 30,000 euros, covering all Schengen countries.
  • Financial guarantees: Evidence of sufficient funds to cover expenses during the stay.
  • Accommodation: Confirmation of hotel reservation or invitation from a private person.
  • Visa fee: Payment of the visa fee.

Additional Documents:

May be required depending on the purpose of the trip, including an invitation from an organisation for business visits, confirmation of an educational institution for students, etc.

Long-term visa and residence permit

Staying in the Czech Republic for more than 90 days requires a national visa (type D) or a residence permit, depending on the purpose of the long-term stay.

Basic Requirements:

  • Visa/residence permit application: Completed as required.
  • A valid passport.
  • Photographs: Eligible.
  • Financial evidence: To prove the ability to support yourself during your stay.
  • Health insurance: To cover medical expenses.
  • Documents confirming the purpose of stay: e.g. employment contract, invitation from an educational institution, etc.

Important Notes
